title: Pregnant Marnie Simpson books induction date as she admits she's suffering
text:
Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Marnie Simpson has booked her induction after admitting she's "struggling" in the final days of her pregnancy.

The Geordie Shore star is 10 days overdue and having a tough time.

The 27-year-old is expecting her first child, a baby boy, with boyfriend Casey Johnson, but says she feels "horrific" now that she's gone so far beyond her due date.

Marnie told fans she's booked her induction as she thanked her beau for being there for her as she's struggled through.

Sharing a sweet snap of them together on Instagram , she said: "So blessed to have this human in my life. I’ve Suffered so badly the last week as I’m now 10 days over due and i have to admit it’s tough and I feel horrific in so many ways!

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

"words can’t explain the discomfort, but generally wouldn’t be able to get through it without you @caseycodyj love you so much! I’m so lucky to have you by my side!!

"And for everyone wondering I have my induction booked so this little guy is coming weather he likes it or not thanks for all the support and messages it means a lot in my down days! I’ll try and keep you all updated on me and the baby when he makes his arrival!

"hope you all have a great weekend"

Her fans offered her some words of encouragement.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: marns/Instagram)

One said: "I went to 42 weeks. You can do this mama! All worth it!"

And another said: "All the best my sweetie, stay strong you’ve got this"

Marnie has spoken about how much she's enjoyed being pregnant, and admitted she never thought she'd get to the stage she's at now.

She recently shared a sexy snap of herself wearing a sheer jumpsuit that revealed her nipples as she looked back at her pre-pregnancy body.

(Image: Instagram)

She said: "Day dreaming of what it felt like to not be pregnant! Really didn’t think it would get to this stage but I’m honestly so tired and fed up and just want to have my baby now! How woman do pregnancy 4/5 times I’ll never know I have a great amount of respect for women as I now know it’s not easy!

"hoping I’ll get this body back sometime in the near future but for now here is a TB picture of my waist as I’ve forgot what it looks like"

Do you have a story to sell? Get in touch with us at webcelebs@trinitymirror.com or call us direct 0207 29 33033
description: The Geordie Shore star has admitted she's "struggling" after getting to 10 days beyond her due date with her first child
